channel.title: HD server
channel.description: So i have started a 508 server. How can i make it HD? (fullscreen or just bigger screen than normal) I think it belongs on client doesn't it?

item.title: HD server
item.dc:creator: @eNz0x eNz0x
item.description:
@eNz0x wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:5, topic:395165”][quote author=eNz0x link=topic=492356.msg3600758#msg3600758 date=1305529723]
Thanks,

I can’t understand this step? Where will i find this magic book switch code?

[code]Step 4.2
Fixing the switching between spell books issue:
Where-ever you switch your magic books (commands, objectoption1, dialogues, or whatever)
replace the lines with

Code:

p.frames.setTab(p, p.getMagicTabId(), INSERT_INTERFACE_ID_HERE);

And declare this int in player.java
Code:

public int getMagicTabId() {
if(usingHD) {
return 93;
}
return 79;
}
[/code]
[/quote]

That depends on how you change your mage book.[/quote]

I have fixed this. Thanks for help.

Read full topic

item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“eNz0x, post:4, topic:395165”]Thanks,

[code]Step 4.2
Fixing the switching between spell books issue:
Where-ever you switch your magic books (commands, objectoption1, dialogues, or whatever)
replace the lines with

Code:

p.frames.setTab(p, p.getMagicTabId(), INSERT_INTERFACE_ID_HERE);

And declare this int in player.java
Code:

public int getMagicTabId() {
if(usingHD) {
return 93;
}
return 79;
}
[/code][/quote]

That depends on how you change your mage book.

item.title: HD server
item.dc:creator: @eNz0x eNz0x
item.description:
@eNz0x wrote:

Thanks,

I can’t understand this step? Where will i find this magic book switch code?

[code]Step 4.2
Fixing the switching between spell books issue:
Where-ever you switch your magic books (commands, objectoption1, dialogues, or whatever)
replace the lines with

Code:

p.frames.setTab(p, p.getMagicTabId(), INSERT_INTERFACE_ID_HERE);

And declare this int in player.java
Code:

public int getMagicTabId() {
if(usingHD) {
return 93;
}
return 79;
}
[/code]

item.title: HD server
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[size=36pt]CREDITS TO MENDOMORPHIN![/size]

[code]Purpose: Adding low detail & high detail fullscreen support on your 508.

Difficulty: 5/10

Tested On: Palis 508. stylers 508 (soon to realese source, fullscreen hd comes with it.)

you might want to back up your files in case you mess up.

Step 1
Open Player.java and declare this boolean

Code:
public boolean usingHD;Step 2
Open Login.java and replace this part of your login block:

Code:
p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) {
int cacheIDX = p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
}
String junk = p.stream.readString();
for (int i = 0; i < 29; i++) {
int junk2 = p.stream.readDWord();
}
loginEncryptPacketSize–;
int encryption = p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
if (encryption != 10) {
p.loginStage = -1;
return;
}With:

Code:
p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) {
int cacheIDX = p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
}
String junk = p.stream.readString();
for (int i = 0; i < 29; i++) {
int junk2 = p.stream.readDWord();
}
loginEncryptPacketSize–;
int junk29 = p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
if(junk29 == 10)
p.usingHD = true;
else
p.usingHD = false;
int encryption = junk29;
if(!(encryption == 10 || encryption == 64)) {
encryption = p.stream.readUnsignedByte();
}
if (encryption != 10 && encryption != 64) {
p.loginStage = -1;
return;
}Step 2.1
Now search for (NOTE: This will be in your ActionButtons.java if you have a welcome screen, if not still in Login.java)

Code:
p.frames.setWindowPane(p, 548);And replace it with:

Code:
if(p.usingHD)
p.frames.setWindowPane(p, 549);
else
p.frames.setWindowPane(p, 548);Step 3
Open up your Frames.java and remove the following methods:

Code:
public void setTab(Player p, int tabId, int childId)Code:
public void setOverlay(Player p, int childId)Code:
public void removeOverlay(Player p)Code:
public void showInterface(Player p, int childId)Code:
public void removeShownInterface(Player p)Code:
public void setInventory(Player p, int childId)Code:
public void restoreInventory(Player p)(Might not have this one, skip it)

Code:
public void showTabs(Player p)(Might not have this one, skip it)

Code:
public void setInterfaces(Player p)Step 3.1
Now add all these methods:

Code:
/**
* Setting a tab.
* @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
* @param tabId Which tab to display the interface on.
* @param childId The interface to display on the tab.
*/
public void setTab(Player p, int tabId, int childId) {
if(!p.usingHD)
setInterface(p, 1, childId == 137 ? 752 : 548, tabId, childId);
else
setInterface(p, 1, 746, tabId, childId);
}

/**
 * Set the overlay to be displayed.
 * @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
 * @param childId The interface id to display as an overlay.
 */
public void setOverlay(Player p, int childId) {
  if(!p.usingHD)
    setInterface(p, 1, 548, 5, childId);
  else
    setInterface(p, 1, 746, 5, childId);
}

/**
 * Remove any overlays that might be set.
 * @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
 */
public void removeOverlay(Player p) {
  if(!p.usingHD)
    setInterface(p, 1, 548, 5, 56);
  else
    setInterface(p, 1, 746, 5, 56);
}

/**
 * Display an interface on the main area in the screen.
 * @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
 * @param childId the interface id to display.
 */
public void showInterface(Player p, int childId) {
p.interfaceId = childId;
  if(!p.usingHD)
    setInterface(p, 0, 548, 8, childId);
  else
    setInterface(p, 0, 746, 3, childId);
}

/**
 * Remove an interface on the main screen.
 * @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
 */
public void removeShownInterface(Player p) {
  if(!p.usingHD)
    setInterface(p, 1, 548, 8, 56);
  else
    setInterface(p, 1, 746, 3, 56);
 p.interfaceId = -1;
}
/**
 * Set the inventory.
 * @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
 * @param childId The interface to display on the inventory.
 */

public void setInventory(Player p, int childId) {
    if(!p.usingHD)
    setInterface(p, 0, 548, 71, childId);
    else {
    setInterface(p, 0, 746, 71, childId);
    }
}

public void restoreInventory(Player p) {
if(p.usingHD)
setInterface(p, 1, 746, 71, 56);
else
setInterface(p, 1, 548, 71, 56);
showTabs§;
}

public void showTabs(Player p) {
int maininterface = 548;
if(p.usingHD) {
maininterface = 746; /Need to get correct configs for it, but it works/
}
for (int b = 16; b <= 21; b++) {
setInterfaceConfig(p, maininterface, b, false);
}
for (int a = 32; a <= 38; a++) {
setInterfaceConfig(p, maininterface, a, false);
}
setInterfaceConfig(p, maininterface, 14, false);
setInterfaceConfig(p, maininterface, 31, false);
setInterfaceConfig(p, maininterface, 63, false);
setInterfaceConfig(p, maininterface, 72, false);
}
/**
* Set interface defaults at login.
* @param p The Player which the frame should be created for.
*/
public void setInterfaces(Player p) {
if (p == null || p.disconnected[0]) {
return;
}
if(!p.usingHD) {
setTab(p, 6, 745);
setTab(p, 11, 751); // Chat options
setTab(p, 68, 752); // Chatbox
setTab(p, 64, 748); // HP bar
setTab(p, 65, 749); // Prayer bar
setTab(p, 66, 750); // Energy bar
setTab(p, 67, 747);
setConfig(p, 1160, -1);
setTab(p, 8, 137); // Playername on chat
setTab(p, 73, 92); // Attack tab
setTab(p, 74, 320); // Skill tab
setTab(p, 75, 274); // Quest tab
setTab(p, 76, 149); // Inventory tab
setTab(p, 77, 387); // Equipment tab
setTab(p, 78, 271); // Prayer tab
setTab(p, 79, 192); // Magic tab
setTab(p, 81, 550); // Friend tab
setTab(p, 82, 551); // Ignore tab
setTab(p, 83, 589); // Clan tab
setTab(p, 84, 261); // Setting tab
setTab(p, 85, 464); // Emote tab
setTab(p, 86, 187); // Music tab
setTab(p, 87, 182); // Logout tab
} else if(p.usingHD) {
setTab(p, 13, 748); //energy orb
setTab(p, 14, 749); //energy orb
setTab(p, 15, 750); //energy orb
setTab(p, 16, 747); //summing orb
setTab(p, 18, 751); //things below chatbox
setInterface(p, 1, 549, 0, 746); // Main interface
setTab(p, 87, 92); // Attack tab
setTab(p, 88, 320); // Skill tab
setTab(p, 89, 274); // Quest tab
setTab(p, 90, 149); // Inventory tab
setTab(p, 91, 387); // Equipment tab
setTab(p, 92, 271); // Prayer tab
setTab(p, 93, 192); // Magic tab
setTab(p, 94, 662); // Summoning tab
setTab(p, 95, 550); // Friend tab
setTab(p, 96, 551); // Ignore tab
setTab(p, 97, 589); // Clan tab
setTab(p, 98, 261); // Setting tab
setTab(p, 99, 464); // Emote tab
setTab(p, 100, 187); // Music tab
setTab(p, 101, 182); // Logout tab
setInterface(p, 1, 752, 8, 137); // Chatbox
setTab(p, 65, 752); // Chatbox, both required
setTab(p, 18, 751); // Settings below chatbox
setTab(p, 13, 748); // HP orb
setTab(p, 14, 749); // Prayer orb
setTab(p, 15, 750); // Energy orb
setTab(p, 12, 747); // Summoning orb
}
}Step 4
Your fullscreen works now, but some things are messed up! we are going to fix these things now.

Step 4.1
In walking.java add this
Code:

Code:
p.frames.restoreInventory§;under

Code:
p.frames.removeShownInterface§;Step 4.2
Fixing the switching between spell books issue:
Where-ever you switch your magic books (commands, objectoption1, dialogues, or whatever)
replace the lines with

Code:
p.frames.setTab(p, p.getMagicTabId(), INSERT_INTERFACE_ID_HERE);And declare this int in player.java

Code:
public int getMagicTabId() {
if(usingHD) {
return 93;
}
return 79;
}Step 4.3
Fixing the switching between attack style interfaces issue:
Find your way to PlayerWeapon.java
and replace all those lines (they look like this)

Code:
p.frames.setTab(p, 73, Some_id_goes_here);With:

Code:
p.frames.setTab(p, p.getAttackTabId(), INSERT_INTERFACE_ID_HERE);And declare in player.java

Code:
public int getAttackTabId() {
if(usingHD) {
return 87;
}
return 73;
}Step 4.4
Fixing Banking:
Replace your openBank() method (player.java) with:

Code:
public void openBank() {
frames.setConfig2(this, 563, 4194304);
frames.setConfig2(this, 1248, -2013265920);
frames.showInterface(this, 762);
frames.setInventory(this, 763);
frames.setBankOptions(this);
frames.setItems(this, -1, 64207, 95, bankItems, bankItemsN);
frames.setItems(this, -1, 64209, 93, items, itemsN);
if(usingHD) {
frames.setInterfaceConfig(this, 746, 35, true);
frames.setInterfaceConfig(this, 746, 70, false);
for(int i = 87; i < 100; i++) {
frames.setInterfaceConfig(this, 746, i, true);
}
}
}This will make tabs unclickable in HD

Step 4.5
Fixing Shops:
Go to your ShopHandler.java and add

Code:
if(p.usingHD) {
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 35, true);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 70, false);
for(int i = 87; i < 100; i++) {
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, i, true);
}
}Under:

Code:
public void shopopen(Player p, int shopId) {
p.frames.removeShownInterface§;
p.frames.showInterface(p, 620); //Shop
p.frames.setInventory(p, 621);
p.frames.setTab(p, 80, 621);//InvStep 4.6
Fixing Trade:
Step 4.6.1
ok so start out in your ptrade.java file and replace your refreshscreens method with this:
Code:
public void refreshScreens() {
switch (this.tradeStage) {
case 1:
p.pTrade.showFirst();
getPartner().pTrade.showFirst();
break;
case 2:
p.pTrade.showSecond();
getPartner().pTrade.showSecond();
break;
}
if(p.usingHD) {
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 35, true);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 70, false);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 68, false);
for(int i = 87; i < 100; i++) {
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, i, true);
}
}
if(getPartner().usingHD) {
getPartner().frames.setInterfaceConfig(getPartner(), 746, 35, true);
getPartner().frames.setInterfaceConfig(getPartner(), 746, 70, false);
getPartner().frames.setInterfaceConfig(getPartner(), 746, 68, false);
for(int i = 87; i < 100; i++) {
getPartner().frames.setInterfaceConfig(getPartner(), 746, i, true);
}
}
}then replace your restoreplayer method with this:

Code:
public void restorePlayer() {
if(p.usingHD) {
p.frames.showInterface(p, 336); //Will bring back inv options when you click on minimap to move, not real method tho ;l
p.frames.setItems(p, -1, 1, 93, new int[]{}, new int[]{});
return;
}
p.frames.setItems(p, -1, 1, 93, new int[]{}, new int[]{});

    for (int b = 16; b <= 21; b++) {
        p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 548, b, false);
    }

    for (int a = 32; a <= 38; a++) {
        p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 548, a, false);
    }
    p.calculateEquipmentBonus();

    p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 548, 14, false);
    p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 548, 31, false);
    p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 548, 63, false);

    p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 548, 72, false);
}then add this

Code:
p.frames.restoreInventory§;under

Code:
p.frames.sendMessage(p, “Trade completed.”);then add this:

Code:
this.p.frames.removeShownInterface§;
under

Code:
this.p.pTrade.restorePlayer();

Step 4.6.2
Go to TButtons.java and right before the last closing bracket of of the inventoryItems method add these lines:

Code:
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 70, false);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 68, false);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 35, true);Step 4.6.3
Fixing offer X
Go to UserInput.java, find your ParseInput method and outside the switch add

Code:
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 70, false);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 68, false);
p.frames.setInterfaceConfig(p, 746, 35, true);I have updated this, you don’t need the resetinput so i removed, have a good day! [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: HD server

item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Is it not already coded in? You should just be able to go to the graphics settings and change it.
